item.title: Switch 2 worldwide sales top 17.37 million, Switch tops 155.37 million
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

7.01 million Switch 2 units sold in the three months ended December 31, 2025.

Nintendo Switch 2 has sold 17.37 million units and Switch has sold 155.37 million units worldwide as of December 31, 2025, Nintendo announced in its latest earnings release. Switch has now outsold DS, which sold 154.02 million units, and has become Nintendo’s best selling hardware to date.

A total of 7.01 million Switch 2 hardware and 17.31 million software were sold during the three months ended December 31, 2025, while a total of 1.36 million Switch hardware and 47.37 million software were sold.

Nintendo also shared updated sales numbers for its first-party Switch 2 and Switch titles.

The 10 best-selling first-party titles are:

Switch 2

  1. Mario Kart World – 14.03 million
  2. Donkey Kong Bananza – 4.25 million
  3. Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition – 3.89 million
  4. Kirby Air Riders – 1.76 million

Switch

  1. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe – 70.59 million
  2. Animal Crossing: New Horizons – 49.32 million
  3. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate – 37.44 million
  4. The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – 33.64 million
  5. Super Mario Odyssey – 30.27 million
  6. Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet – 28.08 million
  7. Pokemon Sword / Pokemon Shield – 27.08 million
  8. The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – 22.40 million
  9. Super Mario Party – 21.28 million
  10. New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe – 18.80 million

Newly announced additional first-party sales numbers include:

  • Nintendo Switch Sports – 17.84 million
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder – 17.15 million
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree – 9.41 million
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Switch) – 8.41 million
  • Super Mario Galaxy (Switch) – 2.28 million
  • Super Mario Galaxy 2 (Switch) – 2.24 million

More than 37.93 million Switch 2 games and 1,500.16 million Switch games have been sold worldwide.
